snippet: A Federal Court of Appeals refused today to order California, in the absence of a state budget, to continue payments to the health-care workers who serve the poor.   The decision, issued by the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit,...
lead_paragraph: A Federal Court of Appeals refused today to order California, in the absence of a state budget, to continue payments to the health-care workers who serve the poor. The decision, issued by the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, means that the state will not make Medi-Cal payments after this week if the budget deadlock between Gov. Pete Wilson and the Legislature continues. The next payment is scheduled for Aug. 20.
